of Python from basic installation now if you are a student who has studied something like C++, Java, JavaScript and now you want to learn Python or if you are a student who is going to do programming from the beginning then this video is made for you after watching this video if you want you can prepare for college placements, do competitive coding, learn about frameworks like Django in web development or learn things like artificial intelligence, machine learning, data science to do this video we will need only two things, first is a laptop and second is a lot of excitement so let's start our brand new Python course Python is a very beautiful language which is used in a lot of big companies big companies like Google, YouTube, Instagram, Netflix, Uber use Python to make their install Python in Windows first of all we have to go to a website named python.org we have given the link of the website in the notes below and you can see it on the screen so by going to downloads we will download Python 3.1 0.0 after downloading we will open this file in our folder then we have to click on the exe file and install it now the software we will use to write Python in Windows is called PyScripter PyScripter is an open source free software which we can go to the site after going to the website we have downloaded it once after that we will have a window of different options so have written hello world with double quotes so whatever text is there in Python we write it in quotes we could have written hello world in single quotes but since I am from Java C++ background so my actually T is capital so if we don't take care of case if we keep capital of things we will make them small or small one will be capital then error can come here we can write false also if our age was less than 18 similarly we can define boolean variables in python special thing of python is you don't have to tell before defining variables that which type this variable is going to be you can store will learn if we have to take something in input then how we can take it from user so for that we are using a function called input what does input do any value takes input from user so here we have then again to show it to user we print it to print it more nicely we can write hello here and we can put plus sign in between so what will happen with this plus sign with hello our name string will be are integers we will pass old age in int so in this way its output will convert in old age in integer so here if we write int in that we passed old age and then run the code so now if we pass our age what we need to change first we will enter our first number suppose we enter 2 and then enter second number 3 so what we printed nothing yet because we didn't print sum so let's print sum run again here it printed 23 so why 23 of 2 and 3 printed because our first and second both are string we didn't convert type so here concatenation happened first is connected to second so 3 is connected to 2 to remove concatenation we have to convert it in int so first we will convert in int second we will convert in int then we will calculate sum run again so first we will pass 2 second we will pass 3 output is 5 so how to write sum of both we can write many programs in python now suppose before print we have to print the sum is and here we will write plus so in that case it will not print directly in that case error will come that we can't concatenate string with int so to print this sum we have to convert in string form then our sum will be printed correctly now in python we will talk about a a string if we want to search any character or sub string so for that we can simply write dot find so suppose in Tony Stark we have to search for capital S so here we will write print name dot find we will pass our capital S in it now to define strings in python we can use double quotes or single quotes but since I am from C++ and Java background so when I have to define characters which means single A single B, single C, single at the rate so I use single quotes and when we have to define strings like word or sentence or a whole paragraph so I use double quotes you can use any quote as per your wish so here we are going to find this capital S in our name so this find will find any particular character or sub string in the string if it finds it so wherever it finds on index it will return the index and if it doesn't find it, it will return minus 1 what is index? in python, index is our position like if we talk about this name string so in this, on zeroth position comes T, on first position comes O, on second position comes N on third position comes Y on fourth position comes space so whatever are the indexes in python, they start from zero means they don't start from first position they start from zeroth position same is in C++ same is in Java but there are many languages which start from index 1 but we are talking about zero indexing so here if we run this code so where did it find S? on index 5 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 on index 5 comes our capital S suppose we have to search small s so in that case here returns minus 1 because small s is not in our string apart from that we can find any sub string like suppose we want to find star that also starts from our index 5 but if we make s small of star so in that case minus 1 will be printed so in this way we have to be careful which case character or string we are searching now next operation which we will talk about is that in string we can pick any part and replace it with any other part like here instead of replace? with Iron Man so run it now what is printed for us? Iron Man but it doesn't change original string so if we print name again then our original name will be printed which is Tony Stark now suppose we want to print Tony Iron Man instead of Stark so from here we will remove Tony so we will be replacing Stark with this term so what is printed for us? Tony Iron Man so in this way we can replace existing substring or even whole string we can also replace characters if we replace T with M then we have Moni Stark so we can also replace characters now what does find function do? find function will bring index for us so in any position it will get a character or substring but we just have to check whether that substring or character exists or not we don't have to check its index so for that we use an in keyword what are keywords? like in any language there is a dictionary which defines that these words are part of this language similarly keywords of programming languages are part of dictionary of programming languages like in English language we know that apple is a word orange is a word when we use input so input is a keyword along with that we use print so print is also a keyword then only it is highlighted in our editor with purple rest of the variables which we define are not highlighted they are simply visible in white so all the keywords are highlighted if we are writing any text that is highlighted in green now if we want to find any character or substring in our string so we use in function we want to find capital T in name so for us print is true does our capital T exists in our name string so in that case for us print is true but if we want to find m so for that print will be false that m does not exist if we want to find substring that does star exist in name so for that it will be true now if we want to find iron man so for that it will be false so in this way we can search by getting true false in any string now next we are going to talk about arithmetic operators what are arithmetic operators like in math we have studied many operations whenever we have studied in 1st, 2nd, 3rd class of math we had to do plus so we used plus sign minus sign multiply so for all these operations the operator used that is the signs used we call them operators in python now here we will see different operators they are almost similar to what we have used in math first operator is plus so we will print 5 plus 2 so we will see sum from plus operator after that if we replace plus with minus so this is used for subtraction so it is 5 minus 2 print is 3 if we want to multiply so we will put asterisk so on our keyboard this asterisk sign is multiplication in programming so 5 into 2 is printed if we want to print so we will put slash slash means divide in arithmetic operators so we have printed 5 divided by 2 is equal to 2.5 now when we multiply any two numbers so either our result can be in decimal or in integer like here if we were dividing 10 by 2 so answer would have been 5 but if we are dividing 5 by 2 so answer is 2.5 suppose there are some cases where we don't want decimal numbers so to remove decimal numbers to take only integer value we will make this slash double so when we put two slashes or two divide signs so our decimal part will be removed from result so we run it so 2.5 is not printed only 2 is printed now along with this there is another operator in programming, it is in java, c++ and python which is not usual in maths it is our remainder operator it is also called modulo so this sign of percentage represents our remainder operator what does remainder operator do? when we divide two numbers so whatever remainder is left it returns that so we print this 5 divided by 2 remainder is 1 along with this there is another operator which is power operator so to make one number to make power of one number we put two asterisks or two stars so here we put star star it means 5 to the power 2 which is 25 when we run it it will be 25 printed now in python there are some shortcuts to calculate things which we should know so first of all let's assume we have a variable in which we wrote 5 in the beginning now what we did we added 2 in 5 and we assigned i to this whole so whenever there is such expression in python we can minimize it and write we can write this whole expression plus equal to 2 so this first line and this second line both have same meaning in python similarly if we want to minus then we can write minus equal to 2 and if we want to multiply then multiply equal to 2 so in this way we can perform many operations by minimizing them now in python let's talk about operator precedence operator precedence means if we have given some expression like 2 plus 3 into 5 or this expression can be 2 plus 3 means 5 into 5 25 or it can be 3 into 5 15 plus 2 so 17 now which one will be right it depends on which operator in python takes precedence means which operator will perform first operation so there is a rule of board math similarly there is a rule in python now the operator precedence has a whole chart which operator will take precedence you can get that in link here we will discuss in a little while we will discuss that multiplier operator has higher precedence as compared to plus operator so here result is 17 so first 3 into 5 will be multiplied after that 2 will be added if we want to add 2 first then we can put brackets if we put brackets then result will be 25 similarly here if we multiply then multiply will be before plus so after multiplying we get 2.6 so in this way we have precedence of different operators now let's discuss another small thing in python that is comments code part which doesn't do any calculation doesn't perform any operation means there are things which we have to write on our screen but we don't want to make them part of code suppose we want to write them in normal english so we call them comments how do we write comments suppose we write hash so all comments start with hash in python after that we can write here is a comment so this is a normal english line but here we will not get error why? because here we have made it a comment if we would have written this line below then we would have got an error so how can we write normal english in python we can write comments now what is the work of comments whenever we go to organizations or companies or start ups or whenever we are writing a good code so your code at some point of time someone else must be reading it now that person should understand which part of your long code performs for that you write a comment on every part like we made a small program of two numbers so in that first comment would have been taking input so first is equal to input we would have done something after that our second comment would have been calculate sum so in this way to define our program we can use comments now we are going to read in python about comparison operators comparison means comparing two things which is big and which is small now to compare in python there are some operators these operators return boolean value means whatever operator you have applied its true or false will depend on what condition you have applied so first of all we have to print 3 is greater than 2 so is 3 greater than 2 yes it is so its result will be true but here we can do 3 is less than 2 so this is a comparison operator in that case we will get return false in the same way less than equal to so in this also we will get false but if we write greater than equal to so it will be true now there is another comparison operator which compares two values so if we have to compare is 3 value equal to 2 value so in that case we will write equal to equal to so this operator will check if two values are equal or not if we run it then output will be false but if we write 3 instead of 2 so in that case we will get result as true now we have checked equal to equal to there is also an operator called not equal to to do not equal to you have to remove one equal to and in the beginning you have to put an exclamation mark exclamation means not now those students who have studied logic gates or in college in that we know that if we put not any value will be reversed so in python also when we put exclamation or not then everything will be reversed true becomes false and false becomes true so if we have to compare two values so 3 not equal to 3 the output we will get will be false and if we write 2 so its output will be true means when two values are equal and in between not equal to then its output is false means you are saying wrong but if two values are not equal and in between also not equal then its output will be true now next the operators we are going to study their name is logical operators in python there are 3 types of logical operators first is our OR operator what does OR operator do if we give two conditions to this operator suppose one condition is true and one condition is false so what will it do if one of the two condition is true so it will print true if both are false then it will print false so if we want to print 2 is greater than 3 or 2 is greater than 1 so here 2 is greater than 3 will return false and 2 is greater than 1 will return true so the final output that will return will be true now apart from this there is another operator that is AND operator what does AND operator do it will print true in all other cases it will print false so for example print 3 is greater than 2
